headline: Why WK Kellogg Shares Skyrocketed This Week
summary: Kellogg shares rocketed higher after the company announced it was being acquired for $23.  Shares of cereal maker WK Kellogg (NYSE: KLG) rose 34% this week as of noon E.T. Thursday, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence.  One week after being added to a slew of Russell Value indexes, it turns out WK Kellogg was indeed a good value investment -- at least in the eyes of Ferrero.

content.title: Why WK Kellogg Shares Skyrocketed This Week
content.summary: Kellogg shares rocketed higher after the company announced it was being acquired for $23.  Shares of cereal maker WK Kellogg (NYSE: KLG) rose 34% this week as of noon E.T. Thursday, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence.  One week after being added to a slew of Russell Value indexes, it turns out WK Kellogg was indeed a good value investment -- at least in the eyes of Ferrero.

thumbnail.caption: A shopper looks at a cereal box while standing in an aisle at a grocery store.

headline: Analysis-Trump's antitrust enforcers 'get out of the way' of multibillion-dollar deals
summary: (Reuters) -President Donald Trump's antitrust enforcers recently cleared a string of multibillion-dollar deals in a week, demonstrating a willingness to settle with companies that marks a shift from the Biden administration.  The U.S. Department of Justice's Antitrust Division and the U.S. Federal Trade Commission cleared three deals that were together worth $63 billion in June, illustrating how FTC Chairman Andrew Ferguson and DOJ antitrust head Gail Slater are taking a different tack from their predecessors.  The settlements, along with a return to formally cutting short waiting periods, provide certainty to dealmakers and could smooth the path for companies like Nutella maker Ferrero, which on Thursday entered a deal to pay $3.1 billion for cereal maker WK Kellogg.

content.title: Analysis-Trump's antitrust enforcers 'get out of the way' of multibillion-dollar deals

The U.S. Department of Justice's Antitrust Division and the U.S. Federal Trade Commission cleared three deals that were together worth $63 billion in June, illustrating how FTC Chairman Andrew Ferguson and DOJ antitrust head Gail Slater are taking a different tack from their predecessors.  The settlements, along with a return to formally cutting short waiting periods, provide certainty to dealmakers and could smooth the path for companies like Nutella maker Ferrero, which on Thursday entered a deal to pay $3.1 billion for cereal maker WK Kellogg.

headline: WK Kellogg stock skyrockets on news of Ferrero deal
summary: WK Kellogg (KLG) stock is skyrocketing after news broke that Ferrero will acquire the company in a $3.1 billion deal. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Morning Brief to break down what the deal means for Ferrero's growing US footprint and Kellogg's struggling cereal business. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Snap, crackle, sale: Nutella maker Ferrero plans to buy WK Kellogg for $3 billion
summary: Italian confectioner Ferrero, known for brands like Nutella and Kinder, is buying the century-old U.S. cereal company WK Kellogg in an effort to expand its North American sales.  The Ferrero Group said Thursday it will pay $23 for each Kellogg share, or approximately $3.1 billion.  The transaction includes WK Kellogg Co.'s six manufacturing plants and the marketing and distribution of its breakfast cereals across the United States, Canada and the Caribbean.

content.title: Snap, crackle, sale: Nutella maker Ferrero plans to buy WK Kellogg for $3 billion
content.summary: Italian confectioner Ferrero, known for brands like Nutella and Kinder, is buying the century-old U.S. cereal company WK Kellogg in an effort to expand its North American sales.  The Ferrero Group said Thursday it will pay $23 for each Kellogg share, or approximately $3.1 billion.  The transaction includes WK Kellogg Co.'s six manufacturing plants and the marketing and distribution of its breakfast cereals across the United States, Canada and the Caribbean.

summary: The acquisition would add cereals such as Froot Loops and Rice Krispies, giving the Luxembourg-based company a deeper U.S. presence in everything from cookies to ice cream.

thumbnail.caption: Boxes of Kellogg's Special K cereal are displayed on shelves at an H-E-B grocery store on May 06, 2025 in Austin, Texas. Kellogg introduced a protein-enhanced version of Special K as consumers look for more nutritional breakfast options.

headline: Froot Loops maker WK Kellogg agrees to $3.1 billion deal from Italy's Ferrero
summary: (Reuters) -WK Kellogg on Thursday agreed to be bought by the owner of Ferrero Rocher in a deal worth around $3.1 billion, uniting two of the world's most recognizable consumer brands to weather a tough spending backdrop marked by persistent inflation.  Kellanova, which was created at the same time as WK Kellogg when Kellogg Company split into two, is also in the process of being acquired by candy giant Mars in a nearly $36 billion deal.  Shares of WK Kellogg jumped 30.6% at $22.85 in mid-day trading on Thursday, nearly matching the premium that Ferrero's $23 per share deal represented.

content.title: Froot Loops maker WK Kellogg agrees to $3.1 billion deal from Italy's Ferrero
content.summary: (Reuters) -WK Kellogg on Thursday agreed to be bought by the owner of Ferrero Rocher in a deal worth around $3.1 billion, uniting two of the world's most recognizable consumer brands to weather a tough spending backdrop marked by persistent inflation.  Kellanova, which was created at the same time as WK Kellogg when Kellogg Company split into two, is also in the process of being acquired by candy giant Mars in a nearly $36 billion deal.  Shares of WK Kellogg jumped 30.6% at $22.85 in mid-day trading on Thursday, nearly matching the premium that Ferrero's $23 per share deal represented.
